Hattie McDaniel (June 10, 1895  October 26, 1952) was an African American 
actress, singer-songwriter, and comedian. She is best known for her role as 
Mammy in Gone with the Wind (1939), for which she won the Academy Award for 
Best Supporting Actress, the first African American to win an Academy Award ....
